alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 4:07PM CST until December 15 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST FOR NORTHERN THURSTON COUNTY... At 405 PM CST, a confirmed tornado was located 6 miles southeast of Emerson, or 22 miles southwest of Sioux City, moving northeast at 60 mph. A second confirmed tornado was located 5 miles southwest of Winnebago, also moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado with this storm. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Thurston County, including the following locations... Thurston. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
